intro: Amphiasma assimile, commonly known as the small goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, golden-yellow flowers that bloom in spring, often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Amphiasma assimile is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
